comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
This has been bugging me for yonks!   It has to be somewhere up the Parramatta River ... ?  The old building at Callan Park ?  Or Gladesville Hospital ?

See also - 

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/7750026376/]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Whoopee! Found it ! It is at the old GLADESVILLE Hospital. Seen on this GoogleMapsSatellite - maps.google.com.au/maps?q=Gladesville,+New+South+Wales&am... . We are looking south from the north side of the building across Parramatta River towards Abbotsford. Anyone know what the building was used for in the asylum?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
ps those plants looked familiar - see - 

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/3683566980/]Gladesville Hospital 1883 (State Records NSW)

I wonder if this photo(s) are also c.1883 ?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Whoopee Again! It is the former Medical Superintendent's Residence (check the unusual arrangement of first floor windows). Designed by Mortimer Lewis 1836-38. < Links to Wikipedia page on Gladesville Hospital

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: this appears to be the same unidentified building, as the next one.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] That was quick! I'd put the two photos of the (previously) unidentified building up as this weeks Can you date mystery! archivesoutside.records.nsw.gov.au/can-you-date-this-phot...

comment.author: 7892196@N02
comment._content: Is there some way of pinning the photo to the Flickr map?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Sorry,  I pre-empted your 'Can You Date' mystery by a couple of days.   I can resist anything except temptation!

I think all three photos are 1883 (as the third one down is listed as).  This matches the wonderful series done at the 'new' asylum at Callan Park.

 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/7892196@N02] I find that Yahoo / Flickr map so inaccurate as to be misleading and useless.  Hence the GoogleMapsSatellite link above.  The exact co-ordinates of the building (from the Google URL) are -
-33.839289 South
151.130319 East

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] The Flickr map itself isn't inaccurate (cartographically speaking) - it's the inaccuracy with which users tend to pin their images to the map that causes it to be unreliable. Which I think is what you meant to say. :)

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Um, thanks ... perhaps I should have said the Flickr map is not high enough resolution (compare the two for the satellite and map views of this house for example),  which in turn leads to inaccuracies with placement.

comment.author: 73199923@N00
comment._content: Gladesville Hospital Item 33 ? Lunatic Asylum established at Tarban Creek in 1837 "The first keeper appointed to the asylum was Joseph Thomas Digby. His wife Susannah was appointed as Matron. Digby purchased 1 acre 25 perches of land adjoining the Asylum in July 1839 where he built his residence (Item 33) c.1841..." www.heritage.nsw.gov.au/07_subnav_04_2.cfm?itemid=3540297 investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/Entity.aspx?Path=%5CSerie...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/hpeters] That Heritage NSW site is interesting - it implies this house was not part of the original Mortimer Lewis design,  and built slightly later in 1841.  The same history mentions "Within the grounds of Gladesville a new superintendent's residence was constructed in 1878 (Item 5t4)."  So what did this building become around the date of this photo (1883?)?.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
OR:  Is this photo of the 1878 NEW Superintendent's Residence?  
Architecture expert and site visit required!

comment.author: 73199923@N00
comment._content: www.facebook.com/notes/friends-of-gladesville-hospital/a-... and Friends of Gladesville Hospital may help www.huntershill.com.au/subsites/index.asp?id=506

comment.author: 86247253@N08
comment._content:
Hi

I am Peter Colthorpe, Coordinator of Friends of Gladesville Hospital, If you want some info or a tour of the site please contact me on pdcol@optusnet.com.au

comment.author: 73199923@N00
comment._content: From Peter Colthorpe "...This is the home of Frederick Norton Manning, Superintendent at the Hospital and subsequently Governor of the Insane for NSW 1869-1903. He was a leading light in improving the lot of Mental Health Patients in the late 1800s..." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_Norton_Manning
